hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Volatility Compression Breakout in BTC
hypothesis_content.statement: During holiday periods with thin liquidity, BTC's 5-day realized volatility dropping below 30% (annualized) followed by a 2% price move in either direction will trigger a momentum continuation in that direction over the next 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday trading creates liquidity voids where volatility compression leads to explosive moves. Thin markets exaggerate momentum as few participants can absorb order flow. News during holidays tends to have outsized impact.
entry_conditions: BTC price moves >2% from previous day's close
Market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL
Volume ratio (current day / 5-day avg) > 1.2 on breakout candle
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout moves reverse >50% within 24 hours more than 60% of the time, or volatility remains compressed despite >2% moves.
